title: W3.JS Add Style to HTML

metadata.description: Learn about W3.JS Add Style to HTML with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Add a CSS property value:
w3.addStyle(
selector
,'
property
','
value
')
Add Style by Id
Add a red background color to an element with id="London":
Example
<button onclick="w3.addStyle('#London','background-color','red')">Add Style</button>

With CSS »
Add Style by Tag
Add a red background color to all <h2> elements:
Example
<button onclick="w3.addStyle('h2','background-color','red')">Add Style</button>

With CSS »
Add Style by Class
Add a red background color to all elements with class="city":
Example
<button onclick="w3.addStyle('.city','background-color','red')">Add Style</button>

With CSS »

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers W3.JS Add Style to HTML concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use W3.JS Add Style to HTML effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of W3.JS Add Style to HTML and how to apply it in your projects.
